content.question: Which of the following statements best describes why birth and death rates are changing in a country that is in Phase 2 of the demographic transition?

choices.label: Individuals have better sanitation and access to clean drinking water.
Individuals have increased availability of birth control and have smaller family sizes.
The population has a high infant mortality rate because of the lack of health care.
The population size stops increasing and may decline if birth rates are lower than death rates.

content.answer: Individuals have better sanitation and access to clean drinking water.
